subject: [Radiance-general] Re: rtrace: -ospec options
body:
Hi Marcin,

I will try to answer your questions inline, below...


This formula is applied for each ray.  You can read the code in src/
rt/raytrace.c if that helps.  Look at the "rayparticipate" function,
which is called from "raytrace".


Can't you use -otvL with -me 0 0 0 in rtrace?  This will report the
ray length and value for the entire ray tree.


Only rays that are linked to tree branches that end in glow surfaces
or light sources will have non-zero values if -av 0 0 0 (the default)
is specified.  I suspect the problem in your case is that -me 0.2 0.2
0.2 is so large that ray paths are never short enough to yield a non-
zero result.


Try the settings above and see what happens.


Best,
-Greg
